description: Sort Python import definitions alphabetically within logical sections.

-h.description: show this help message and exit

-V.description: Displays the currently installed version of isort.

--vn.description: Returns just the current version number without the logo

--only-modified.description: Suppresses verbose output for non-modified files.

--dedup-headings.description: Tells isort to only show an identical custom import heading comment once...

-q.description: Shows extra quiet output, only errors are outputted.

-d.description: Force resulting output to stdout, instead of in-place.

--overwrite-in-place.description: Tells isort to overwrite in place using the same file handle...

--show-config.description: See isort's determined config, as well as sources of config options.

--show-files.description: See the files isort will be run against...

--df.description: Prints a diff of all the changes isort would make...

-c.description: Checks the file for unsorted / unformatted imports...

--ws.description: Tells isort to ignore whitespace differences when --check-only is being used.

--sp.description: Explicitly set the settings path or file...

--cr.description: Explicitly set the config root for resolving all configs...

--resolve-all-configs.description: Tells isort to resolve the configs for all sub-directories...

--profile.description: Base profile type to use for configuration (black, django, etc.).

--old-finders.description: Use the old deprecated finder logic...

-j.description: Number of files to process in parallel. Negative value means use number of CPUs.

--ac.description: Ensures the output doesn't save if the resulting file contains syntax errors.

--interactive.description: Tells isort to apply changes interactively.

--format-error.description: Override the format used to print errors.

--format-success.description: Override the format used to print success.

--srx.description: Automatically sort all re-exports (module level __all__ collections)

--filter-files.description: Tells isort to filter files even when they are explicitly passed in...

-s.description: Files that isort should skip over...

--extend-skip.description: Extends --skip to add additional files that isort should skip over.

--sg.description: Files that isort should skip over (glob pattern).

--extend-skip-glob.description: Additional files that isort should skip over (extending --skip-glob).

--gitignore.description: Treat project as a git repository and ignore files listed in .gitignore...

--ext.description: Specifies what extensions isort can be run against.

--blocked-extension.description: Specifies what extensions isort can never be run against.

--dont-follow-links.description: Tells isort not to follow symlinks...

--filename.description: Provide the filename associated with a stream.

--allow-root.description: Tells isort not to treat / specially...

-a.description: Adds the specified import line to all files...

--append.description: Only adds the imports specified in --add-import if the file contains existing imports.

--af.description: Forces import adds even if the original file is empty.

--rm.description: Removes the specified import from all files.

--float-to-top.description: Causes all non-indented imports to float to the top of the file...

--ca.description: Combines as imports on the same line.

--cs.description: Ensures that if a star import is present, nothing else is imported...

-e.description: Balances wrapping to produce the most consistent line length possible

--ff.description: Switches the typical ordering preference, showing from imports first...

--fgw.description: Force number of from imports ... to be grid wrapped regardless of line length.

-i.description: String to place for indents defaults to " " (4 spaces).

--le.description: Forces line endings to the specified value...

--ls.description: Sort imports by their string length.

--lss.description: Sort straight imports by their string length.

-n.description: Inserts a blank line before a comment following an import.

--sl.description: Forces all from imports to appear on their own line

--nsl.description: One or more modules to exclude from the single line rule.

--tc.description: Includes a trailing comma on multi line imports...

--up.description: Use parentheses for line continuation on length limit instead of slashes.

-l.description: The max length of an import line (used for wrapping).

--wl.description: Specifies how long lines that are wrapped should be.

--case-sensitive.description: Tells isort to include case sensitivity when sorting imports.

--remove-redundant-aliases.description: Tells isort to remove redundant aliases...

--honor-noqa.description: Tells isort to honor noqa comments to enforce skipping those comments.

--treat-comment-as-code.description: Tells isort to treat the specified single line comments(s) as code...

--treat-all-comment-as-code.description: Tells isort to treat all single line comments as code...

--formatter.description: Specify the formatter to use when processing Python code.

--color.description: Tells isort to use color in terminal output.

--ext-format.description: Tells isort to format the given files according to the specified extension.

--star-first.description: Forces star imports to be placed sorted alphabetically...

--split-on-trailing-comma.description: Split imports list that ends with a trailing comma.

--sd.description: Set the default section for imports (default FUTURE).

--only-sections.description: Causes imports to be sorted based on their sections like STDLIB, THIRDPARTY, etc...

--ds.description: Put all imports into the same section separated by blank lines

--fas.description: Force all imports to be sorted alphabetically.

--fss.description: Force imports to be sorted alphabetically within normal sections...

--hcss.description: Honor indentation of comments that are attached to imports.

--srss.description: Sort relative imports an independent section above all other imports...

--fass.description: Force imports to be sorted alphabetically within sections...

-t.description: Force specific imports to the top of their appropriate section.

--combine-straight-imports.description: Combines all straight imports of the same section...

--nlb.description: Sections which should not be split with previous by empty lines.

--src.description: Add an explicitly defined source path...

-b.description: Force isort to recognize a module as part of Python's standard library.

--extra-builtin.description: Extra modules to be included in the list of ones Python ships with.

-f.description: Force isort to recognize a module as part of Python's future libraries.

-o.description: Force isort to recognize a module as being part of a third party library.

-p.description: Force isort to recognize a module as being part of the current python project.

--known-local-folder.description: Force isort to recognize a module as being part of the current python project.

--virtual-env.description: Virtual environment to use for determining whether a package is third-party.

--conda-env.description: Conda environment to use for determining whether a package is third-party.

--py.description: Tells isort to set the known standard library based on the specified Python version.

files.name: files
files.description: One or more Python source files/directories or stdin (-)
